channel.title: Minor Outlying Islands on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Minor Outlying Islands on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: American Guano
item.description: No surprise to anyone, but large countries have this way of splaying out all over the world, with lots of their territories in unexpected areas. The United States is no exception, with its array of minor outlying islands, mostly in the Pacific Ocean. But there’s something weird about how many of these islands, mostly uninhabited today or used as minor scientific or military outposts, came under ownership of the United States.
